Key Match Events: Detroit Pistons forward Tobias Harris scored 24 points with 10 rebounds
Cade Cunningham supplied 18 points for Detroit
Malik Beasley had 12 points off the bench
Tim Hardaway Jr. chipped in 11 and Jalen Duren added 10 with 14 rebounds
Miles Bridges led Charlotte with 20 points, nine rebounds and five assists
Mark Williams had 18 points and nine rebounds for the Hornets
Post-Match Reflections: The Detroit Pistons defeated the visiting Charlotte Hornets 98-94
The Pistons have won five of its last six games
The Hornets have lost nine straight and 17 of their last 18
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons were playing their first game since starting guard Jaden Ivey suffered a fractured left fibula against the Orlando Magic on Wednesday
Charlotte had hopes of ending its skid by holding a 65-52 lead at halftime
The Hornets were clinging to a 47-46 lead, then finished the opening half on a 18-6 run
Others: Detroit scored the first five points of the second half
The Pistons reeled off a 12-2 run that Duren began with a putback and finished off with a dunk
A Bridges turnover led to a Harris fast break layup for a 96-90 advantage
